intro: Arenaria longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-stemmed sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers arranged in elongated peduncles, which are its most distinguishing feature. It thrives in well-drained, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. Arenaria longipedunculata is often found in tundra and mountainous habitats where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
